AltoroJ.name: AltoroJ
AltoroJ.description: WARNING: This app contains security vulnerabilities. AltoroJ is a sample banking J2EE web application. It shows what happens when web applications are written with consideration of app functionality but not app security. It's a simple and uncluttered platform for demonstrating and learning more about real-life application security issues.

node-red-contrib-hcl-iterate-loop.name: node-red-contrib-hcl-iterate-loop
node-red-contrib-hcl-iterate-loop.description: This Node-RED node allows you to build loops, just like a for loop in any programming language do, iterating over the selected parts in the flow. Playing with the starting point, increment/decrement values and condition to be evaluated in each iteration.

commerce-google-analytics-integration.name: commerce-google-analytics-integration
commerce-google-analytics-integration.description: Add Google Analytics to HCL Commerce React Store, using Google Tag Manager.  This functionality has been included in the product from release 9.1.4.0 and beyond.  This asset applies to 9.1.1.0 - 9.1.3.0 only.

commerce-google-analytics-dashboard.name: commerce-google-analytics-dashboard
commerce-google-analytics-dashboard.description: This project is created to create the Google analytics dashboard using google Embed API.  This functionality has been included in the product from release 9.1.4.0 and beyond.  This asset applies to 9.1.1.0 - 9.1.3.0 only.

commerce-google-analytics-integration.name: commerce-google-analytics-integration
commerce-google-analytics-integration.description: Add Google Analytics to HCL Commerce React Store, using Google Tag Manager.  This functionality has been included in the product from release 9.1.4.0 and beyond.  This asset applies to 9.1.1.0 - 9.1.3.0 only.

commerce-image-search-asset.name: commerce-image-search-asset
commerce-image-search-asset.description: Provides the capability to search the HCL Commerce Catalog using image search on React Stores

commerce-social-login-asset.name: commerce-social-login-asset
commerce-social-login-asset.description: Social login enables users to log in to React store by using a social networking account, rather than using credentials dedicated to HCL Commerce which will make the sign up and login process quicker

commerce-google-analytics-dashboard.name: commerce-google-analytics-dashboard
commerce-google-analytics-dashboard.description: This project is created to create the Google analytics dashboard using google Embed API.  This functionality has been included in the product from release 9.1.4.0 and beyond.  This asset applies to 9.1.1.0 - 9.1.3.0 only.

commerce-voice-search-asset.name: commerce-voice-search-asset

commerce-google-image-indexing-search-as.name: commerce-google-image-indexing-search-asset
commerce-google-image-indexing-search-as.description: Provide the capability to index the Google Vision results as part of a searchable context for the catalog images.

commerce-PayPal.name: commerce-PayPal
commerce-PayPal.description: HCL Commerce V9 includes two new storefronts.  “Emerald” and “Aurora” are included in v9.1 to support either a B2B or a B2C model.  The PayPal (BrainTree) payment gateway is implemented using Headless REST API's which can be integrated to the React storefront by following these instructions

commerce-external-event-trigger-asset.name: commerce-external-event-trigger-asset
commerce-external-event-trigger-asset.description: Marketing activities require the customer's personalization ID. If the event occurs on an external system that cannot pass the customer personalization ID, you need to map information that is known by the external system to the customer personalization ID in HCL Commerce.

commerce-react-barcode-scanner-asset.name: commerce-react-barcode-scanner-asset
commerce-react-barcode-scanner-asset.description: Provide the capability to search the HCL Commerce Catalog using barcode recognition in HCL Commerce React Stores

commerce-Push-Notification.name: commerce-Push-Notification
commerce-Push-Notification.description: Push Notifications help user to receive notifications on the web application. User will be able to see notifications for latest offers also regarding the order status.  This POC will take the user engagement to the next level.  It will reduce the users application journey.

commerce-PunchOut2Go-Integration.name: commerce-PunchOut2Go-Integration
commerce-PunchOut2Go-Integration.description: The integration of HCL Commerce with PunchOut2Go where HCL Commerce provides commerce functionality and PunchOut2Go provides two-way integration between an HCL Commerce store and hundreds of e-procurement and ERP platforms.

commerce-Visual-Merchandising-Widget.name: commerce-Visual-Merchandising-Widget
commerce-Visual-Merchandising-Widget.description: Proof of concept to provide a merchandiser the ability to re-sequence products on a category page using a drag and drop based UI.
